content:
Mario wrote lake exe refactor and I think that it is a great tool! See this thread for the announcement.

In particular, it could be used for helping with automatic updates of lean code after breaking changes, or auto-compliance with linters,

I do not really understand the subtle code that Mario wrote to handle simultaneous editing of a file at multiple locations, but I have tested it a little writing simple scripts to adapt to various circumstances and it has worked well!

At the moment, the only "feature" that is missing, in my opinion, is the possibility of selecting which replacement to make: e.g. if we had a removeDeprecations script, running lake exe refactor --remove-deprecations could do, well just that!

This can certainly come later, since each one of these "patches" needs to go through a separate code-review from refactor anyway.

So, even though I do not really follow what the code does in detail, I have found it easy to use and working as intended.

Is that enough to maintainer merge it?

(#13973 for those on mobile)
Could maybe @Jon Eugster or @Kyle Miller review this one as well?
I completely missed this, sorry! I now added the t-meta label and will have a look within the next two days!
